text: I have done searches on Google and here at Stackoverflow but can not find what I am looking for.
I am relatively new to Python.
I looking to create a "settings" module where various application specific constants will be stored.
Here is how I am wanting to setup my code

code:
import settings

def func():
    var = CONSTANT
    --- do some more coding ---
    return var

text: I am getting a Python error stating: "global name 'CONSTANT' is not defined.
I have noticed on Django's source code their settings.py file has constants named just like I do.
I am confused on how they can be imported to a script and referenced through the application.
Thank you for all your answers!
I get the same error: ImportError: cannot import name CONSTANT
